jim's trucking

Another rap shooting has caused the death of one rapper's lifelong friend. It seems these proud, boastful, armed rappers got in a shootout after some kind of rapper gang function and one of the goons was killed. (Doesn't say much for their marksmanship...it's a shame they didn't all take a dirt nap!)
 
 This is about the fourth rapper shooting in just a few weeks. Maybe if we just leave them alone they'll kill each other off and we won't have to listen to their XXXX anymore.
 
 A local radio station that plays a lot of XXXX put the music aside for a couple of hours the other night and took calls from listeners regarding the recent killings. They had rappers as guest speakers sort of like they were thinking these rapper's opinions were worth listening to. They spoke of putting aside the violence and hatred...WONDERING why this kind of XXXX happens. One of the guest rappers was "Killer" Mike! Well, DUH....when your "songs" are about hatred, carryin' guns, ho girls and a total disrespect for laws, peace and tranquility...what the F do you expect?
 
 It's really pathetic when some jive XXX punk becomes popular to the extent of emulation. We're all in danger of being shot for DISRESPECT!!emoticon_xkill

post_info.post_title: Leave the Rappers alone!!  Maybe they'll kill each other off!

jitobear

Not all rap is gangster rap. My son has a friend who makes up raps - was rapping in the back seat of my car on the way to basketball the other day. He hasn't killed anyone and I sincerely hope you don't wish his death. Not all rap is this stereotype. I know you hate the genre Jim, but I also know you are a better thinker than this. Don't resort to the mental gymnastics of the ignorant.
 
 Anyway if its on the radio - in any genre - ten to one it will suck.
zachvac

Don't resort to the mental gymnastics of the ignorant.

 actually I have a friend who also raps. He did one in favor of gay marriage, and includes a lot of politics, no mention of killing/sex.

There are Christian rappers. The Foogees are distinctly against violence. The Black Eyed Peas rap mostly nonsense - but it isn't violent. I would hazard a guess that most rap ISN'T gangster rap.

 Just a quick note about this...
 
 This shooting occurred about ten minutes from my home, and people here are more peeved that I-75 was closed for seven hours (including morning rush) for the investigation than about a man associated with a rapper getting killed. 
 
 The feeling on the street is that "he asked for it by being associated with rap".
 
 Now, I think that's XXXX.
zachvac

Just a quick note about this...
 
 This shooting occurred about ten minutes from my home, and people here are more peeved that I-75 was closed for seven hours (including morning rush) for the investigation than about a man associated with a rapper getting killed. 
 
 The feeling on the street is that "he asked for it by being associated with rap".
 
 Now, I think that's XXXX.

 
 wow, really? That's pretty bad.
snakespit

The feeling on the street is that "he asked for it by being associated with rap".
 
 Now, I think that's XXXX.

 He asked for it by associating with people who carry guns and are not afraid to use them when someone provides some level of "disrespect"...real or perceived. I have seen many gang shootings, turf shootings, rival drug dealer shootings etc., and they all have one thing in common. People with a warped sense of value where "showing respect" is more important than respecting life. The fact that these are rappers is really inconsequential. Here in Philly we have gang and drug shootings all of the time...for the same reason. They just don't get the same media coverage...because the local drug dealers are not rich or famous. 
 
 Personally, I could care less if a group of rappers, drug dealers, gang members or whatever want to grab a bunch of guns and shoot it out. If someone is willing to shoot someone over "respect", I don't want to share my oxygen with them anyway. I just wish they could have a forum to do it in, say perhaps a large bulletproof room. Nothing Pi$$e$ me off more than a young child or some other innocent bystander getting caught in the crossfire. Unfortunately, it happens far too often.
Phunting

The most amusing aspect of the phenomena, I always feel, is how it travels overseas.
 
 Go to many streets in London and you see kids dressed in clothes supporting teams of sports they neither follow nor understand; talking about 'Feds' (which makes no sense) and 'capping yo' (which makes even less considering they can't get hold of guns over here) in what they think is a 'ghetto' accent but is actually just really bad Cockney.
 
 I just find that so laughable...
Ooaman

 If I'm not mistaken, we got most of our Punk from the UK didn't we? Oh well, at least we got the Beatles and Stones and The Who from the UK which inspired a lot of American Rock. emoticon_xgood Thanks!

 True enough.
 
 ...though today even in London, damned if you can find a decent punk club emoticon_cry 
 
 
 
Oh well, at least we got the Beatles and Stones and The Who from the UK which inspired a lot of American Rock. emoticon_xgood Thanks!
Yep, both our countries have heavily influenced each other's music. 
 
 But this isn't just musical influences, it's a bunch of kids going round pretending to be something they're not. I doubt even at the height of Brit Rock you got American rockers going round saying 'Alright mate? Bloody awful weather we're having, what?'
wallninja

actually I have a friend who also raps. He did one in favor of gay marriage, and includes a lot of politics, no mention of killing/sex.

 
 If that is the case then it does mention sex. Gay is a way of saying homosexual. Homo comes from the Greek word homos which means same. Sexual means of, relating to, involving, or characteristic of sex, sexuality, the sexes, or the sex organs and their functions. So inadvertently his entire rap would have been about sex. But I get your point about how not all rap is bad.
zachvac

If that is the case then it does mention sex. Gay is a way of saying homosexual. Homo comes from the Greek word homos which means same. Sexual means of, relating to, involving, or characteristic of sex, sexuality, the sexes, or the sex organs and their functions. So inadvertently his entire rap would have been about sex. But I get your point about how not all rap is bad.

 
 There is a difference between rapping about sex and rapping about equal rights for people of all sexualities. It's not like he's talking about the homosexuals actually having sex. There's a difference.
wallninja
Yeah I know what you mean. I was just pointing out how it could be connected. I could do that with just about anything. I just figured I'd point out something pointless for humor's sake.
